title: Remote car starters keeping Edmontonians warm as temperatures plummet - Video - CityNews Edmonton
text: Edmonton The latest updates and breaking news, now available around the clock. Check back in with us at any time to find out what's happening, and always be the first to know. CityNews, Everywhere. One of Edmonton's signature chicken restaurants closed its door at one of its locations. According to Alberta's Hospitality Association, restaurants continue to struggle from inflation Edmonton Police are sharing video of encampments, highlighting the risks faced by those living in encampments, first responders and the general Tuesday may as well have been the first day of winter in Edmonton. With the city receiving its first real snowfall. A human rights group is suing the City of Edmonton, alleging that the removal of encampments violate the charter rights of unhoused people. As Laura Krause reports, the court hearing kicked off Wednesday. Allegations of assault have emerged from both police and protestors at the final encampment sweep in downtown Edmonton. Video of the incidents are seen here. 3h ago The province of Alberta is preparing to assist agricultural producers ahead of what could be a record drought this year. The mayor of Edmonton plans to declare a housing and homelessness emergency amid recent encampment closures in the city. One dermatologist explains to CityNews what happens with frostbite, and what happens after.
